page.title: 17TRIGG MORRIS MEN
page.content: My dad is a morris man.Trigg was formed in 1971 and is based at{BODMIN. It started with six dancers and one musician. They do traditional dances from the Cotswolds.Trigg's name came from the{Old Hundred of Trigg}which was an administration area of the County.Trigg's costume consists of green baldricks with a chain design which comes from{Celtic}patterns found on{stone crosses,}white shirts and socks, black breeches and shoes and straw hats decorated with pheasant feathers and fresh flowers.Around their knees they wear bell-pads. The officers of Trigg are the squire (the chairman), the bagman (the treasurer), the foreman (the dance teacher).There is also the fool who keeps the audience amused,the horse who is a symbol of strength and Betty, a man dressed up as a dame.
